imageManagement

Class PixelImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • imageManagement.PixelImage
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RGBPixelImage

    public abstract class PixelImage
extends java.lang.Object
    A PixelImage provides our wrapper for images. It provides a way of abstracting away methods that you don't need to use. A PixelImage represents an image with a specified width and height. It contains functions which allow pixelwise manipulation of the image (in fact, it provides pixlet-wise manipulation of the image) and also contains a function which returns a GUI panel of the image.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PixelImage(java.io.File file)
      Creates a new PixelImage given the file; throws exception if the file is not an image file.
      PixelImage(int width, int height, int bufImType)
      Creates a new (blank) pixelImage of the specified width, height, and type.
